messageBody:
I have a class that use TCP (java.net.Socket), and I fear that the
way the TCP errors are handled are not correct.

I have tried to write a unit test that launch a dummy server in a
separated thread, and try to close the connection on the server level
on the middle of my test.

With that, I manage to test what happen when I receive an unexpected
EOF in the component that I test.

However, this operation doesn't trigger an IOException.

I see an other solution : refactor my component in order to allow my
unit test to provide his own SocketImpl. But this is very very
difficult in my case.

Doe anybody already faces the same situation ? Do you know how to
simulate a TCP error?
